text: Avraham "Avi" Duan (17 October 1955 – 22 September 2018) was an Israeli politician. He was a member of the Knesset for Kadima between 2012 and 2013. He was born in Ramat Gan, Israel.Edri backs Mofaz, Sheetrit likely to join next week The Jerusalem Post, 26 January 2012 In 2008 he headed Shaul Mofaz's campaign for the Kadima leadership election.רגע לפני הפריימריז: מלחמת קבלני הקולות Ma'ariv, 16 September 2008 He lost his seat in the 2013 elections. He died on 22 September 2018, aged 62.Former Knesset member Avi Duan has died; his funeral will take place tomorrow Yedioth Ahronoth, 22 September 2018 ==References== Category:1955 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Members of the Knesset Category:Jewish Israeli politicians Category:Kadima politicians
title: Avi Duan
